alert.note: Alert for Bell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 26 at 7:41PM CDT until April 27 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Texas, including the following counties, Bell, Falls and Limestone. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water on roadways is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marlin, Troy, Bruceville-Eddy, Rosebud, Riesel, Lott, Golinda, Chilton, Thornton, Wilson, Kosse, Tomlinson Hill, McClanahan, Cedar Springs, Highbank, Reagan, Perry, Pleasant Grove, Satin and Wilderville.
info.instruction: Remain alert to the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning.
